page.title: 08AGRICULTURE
page.content: Belchamp St. Paul is entirely surrounded by agricultural land of a consistently high quality classified as Grade 2 by the Ministry of Agriculture. Most of the land is under {arable cultivation,}large fields devoid of tree and hedgerow boundaries which give a somewhat stark appearance. The pattern of farming has drastically changed over the last 40 years. Whereas a 400 acre farm employed 16 men fully, now a mere 2 can do all the work. Not only that, they can grow more crops, for instance an acre used to yield about 10 sacks of corn now an acre will yield between 3 and 5 tons. There are only two main crops -{wheat and barley.}The best barley is used for making beer, the wheat is used for biscuits and animal food. There is a{surplus of grain}and some is stored, some sold to Russia.
